title: Imgur-Enlil
description: The great, inner wall of Babylon was called by the ceremonial Akkadian name Imgur-Enlil, which means "The God Enlil Showed Favor." According to the text Tintir = Babylon, Imgur-Enlil had eight city gates, four on the eastern side of the Euphrates and four on the western side of the river. The Assyrian kings Esarhaddon and Ashurbanipal and the Babylonian kings Nabopolassar, Nebuchadnezzar II, and Nebonidus all undertook construction on Babylonâ€™s great wall. Imgur-Enlil is one of the seven wonders of the ancient according to some classical sources.

properties.description: Representative location based on OpenStreetMap way tracing the visible remains of the northern stretch of the wall of the inner city of Babylon.
properties.title: OSM location of the northern curtain of Imgur-Enlil and Nemed-Enlil

properties.description: Representative location based on OpenStreetMap way tracing the visible remains of the southern stretch of the wall of the inner city of Babylon.
properties.title: OSM Location of the southern curtain of Imgur-Enlil and Nemed-Enlil
